bibl.title: Letter from George M. Sternberg to Walter Reed, July 3, 1893

div1.p: Sternberg wants Reed to be examined for promotion by the Board of Medical Officers.

div1.head: Letter from George M. Sternberg to Walter Reed, July 3, 1893
div1.opener:
Subject.
War Department
SURGEON GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, July 3, 1893.
My Dear Doctor:
div1.p: Yours of June 29th has been received.

The favorable account I have received of your acquire-
ments and scientific zeal from Professor Welch, Dr. Billings and
others, leads me to anticipate for you a successful career in the
new field of duty to which you have been called.

I: write to-day especially to let you know that it is my
intention to ask for a Board of Medical Officers at Omaha, to con-
sist of Bache, Hartsuff and McElderry, for the purpose of examining
several of the senior Captains for promotion, including yourself.
Comegys, Kilbourne and Merrill will also be ordered before this Board.
I: wish you to get through with this examination before coming to Wash-
ington, and it is probable that you will receive orders within a fort-
night.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, Geo. M. Sternberg Captain Walter Reed,
Ass't. Surg. U. S. A.,
Hd-Qrs, Dept. of Dakota,
St. Paul, Minnesota.
